answers.answer: Good for you!! I want those things for you- your on the right track keep it up!!
Started this as recently diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. Insulin 2x per day--anyone have tips for sweet cravings and not go over my caloric balance?

question: I'm 16, 5'8", male, and 230 lbs.  I just started using this app a few days ago because I'm just fed up with gaining weight.  I'm not gaining very quickly, only about 15 lbs. over the last two years, but I'm not getting any taller and I'm ready to lose it.  Anyway, I've been coming in well under my calorie limit and I'm feeling very optimistic.  So, if I continue to do that and walk for about an hour or more a day on a treadmill or outside once the weather cools down, how long do you think it would take for me to get down to about 165-175 lbs.  I know people lose weight at different rates, but just for a bit of a benchmark, my dad used this app for about a month (don't know why he quit) without any exercise and he lost 10 lbs.  Thanks for your help!
title: My Plan for Losing Weight
